Articles.Content:
So, at the moment, im attempting to get a south pole location in KSP, for long days and long nights, but I kinda dont want to site for 5 hours to hyperedit my base across the south pole and it get it right.

Anyone know any good Lat/Lon for it?  (Also, sorry if this is the wrong area, i havent used the fourms since September, I had to get rid of KSP for a bit, due to my comp nearly basically turning into a molten pile of plastics, metals, and various things.)

Well, South pole is right where it's supposed to be, anywhere, ever. -90°S, 0°E

But, you won't see long days/nights there because no planet in KSP has an axial tilt. You'd see constant sunrise going around the horizon, if placed correctly.

However, I don't recommend going straight to South pole, but at least few meters away. Reason: there could be a hole in the surface due to how the terrain is generated.
